entry.title: Black Square Updates TBM 850, Now Native for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Black Square has released v0.1.4 of their TBM 850, introducing native MSFS 2024 support and a comprehensive list of upgrades, fixes, and quality-of-life enhancements. In the MSFS 2024 version, the new walk-around feature is fully supported, letting you interact with chocks, pitot and engine covers, door handles, baggage doors, and more. The aircraft now also has a proper collision model, allowing the walk-arounds to feel more authentic. Avionics get attention too. The Bendix/King KAS 297B now supports vertical speed arming, while new GTNxi 750 and 650 bezels are included, alongside an improved model-switching method. Black Square has also introduced Magnetic Compass Effects, with physics filtering and realistic interference from onboard fields, so your whiskey compass behaves like the real thing. Inside the cabin, interior lighting has been retooled for MSFS 2024, and the EFB tablet has received upgrades. This includes an Ear Discomfort Index on the visualiser page, payload unit selection that persists between sessions, and an option to enable exterior registration meshes, as a workaround for a known MSFS 2024 dynamic registration bug. There is also a fix for 2024âs light-flare bleed-through. V0.1.4 also adds engine-driven fuel pump failure modelling, with corresponding visualiser behaviour. It also introduces custom toe-brake animations and sounds to stop jitter, along with a revised torque source, for faster indication changes. Black Square has corrected cases where a complete electrical failure would inhibit essential variables from updating, restored air conditioning operation on ground power, and tied the cooling turbine to proper bleed-air logic. Fuel pressure and pump cycling now behave correctly when tanks are empty or the selector is off. The TBM 850 v0.1.4 update is available now for all existing customers. You can pick up the aircraft on Contrail for $42.14, including taxes, and it is also offered through other stores, such as Just Flight. For all the latest news and updates, stay tuned on Threshold! entry.title: LHSimulations Releases HEMSOB Pack Hungary for MSFS 2020, 2024 to follow
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. LHSimulations has released its HEMSOB Pack Hungary for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020, adding three authentic emergency medical bases to the sim. Designed for realistic scenarios, the pack gives a look into air ambulance operations across Hungary. Support for MSFS 2024 is planned, though the team says a technical issue has caused a short delay. The acronym HEMSOB stands for Helicopter Emergency Medical Service Operational Base, facilities designed for air ambulance crews to launch rapid-response missions from. The pack, developed in close cooperation with the Hungarian Air Ambulance Nonprofit Ltd., recreates three real-world bases used by EC135 crews in Hungary. These include BudaÃ¶rs (LH10), the countryâs main HEMS base, located just west of Budapest, BalatonfÃ¼red (LH20), which covers the busy Lake Balaton region, and Marcali (LH30), providing coverage for the southwest of the country. Each base features accurate buildings, hangars, ground textures, and realistic helipads, complete with ambient details, such as fencing, lighting, and parked vehicles. For added immersion, you can even open the hangar doors yourself, using COM1 set to 128.15.. Beyond the visuals, LHSimulations has leaned on authentic references, to create a faithful representation of Hungarian HEMS operations. The bases were built with input from active crews, in pursuit of also making the scenery a tribute to the Hungarian Air Ambulance. Each base is equipped with an animated heliport transfer platform, a movable dolly, often running on tracks, that allows the helicopter to land outside, and then be transferred into the hangar. For sim pilots, this means a perfect environment to practise medevac scenarios and low-level VFR, or simply explore Hungary with a helicopter.Â The HEMSOB Pack Hungary is available exclusively through the in-sim Marketplace for $19.50, including taxes. entry.title: Miltech Simulations Releases September Dev Blog, UH-60 Announced, MH-60 Update
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Miltech Simulations has recently shared their September developer update, covering everything from Marketplace and bug fixes to brand-new aircraft announcements.Â The MH-60 continues to be Miltechâs most successful release, being one of the highest-rated helicopters in the in-sim Marketplace, alongside the CH-47. Its next update will tackle a number of outstanding issues, including APU fuel valve bugs, autopilot and trim behaviour, model-matching, and stability improvements for the MFDs. PC users can also expect new explosion effects for Hellfire impacts, and engine values, such as torque and Ng, will be further fine-tuned. However, thereâs a small snag with MSFS 2024 Marketplace distribution. The MH-60 has run into errors during Microsoftâs testing process, which has delayed its release on the new 2024 sim. Miltech says the Marketplace engineering team is actively investigating, and they hope to move forward soon. By popular demand, Miltech has confirmed it is working on the UH-60 Black Hawk, developed in partnership with Blackbird Simulations. The initial release will include the Alpha and Lima variants, with cockpit differences catering to different preferences. Other S-70 derivatives are not planned. While the UH-60 shares DNA with the MH-60, it comes with enough unique features to warrant a separate, standalone product. The team is currently targeting an early 2026 release, with potential discounts, for existing MH-60 owners. The first major update for Miltechâs Mission Hub is on the way, addressing bugs and stability issues while adding new assets and functionality. The tool is also heading to the Microsoft Marketplace this month.Â Optimisations have been made to meet Xboxâs strict performance requirements; however, Xbox users will not be able to share or download community missions at launch. Miltech is working on a cloud-based solution to bring this feature in a future update. Rounding out the blog is a detailed look at Miltechâs upcoming A-1H Skyraider, developed once again with Blackbird Simulations. Known for its ruggedness and versatility during the Korean and Vietnam Wars, the Skyraider is being faithfully recreated with an âultra-detailedâ 3D model, a flight model validated by subject matter experts, and a new soundset by Echo 19. The Skyraider will feature full weapons capability, including bombs, rockets, cannons, and even the infamous âToilet Bombâ, as well as two Vietnam-era carriers (CV-11 Intrepid and CV-10 Yorktown), bundled at no extra cost. Mission Hub users will also get a mission pack with over 10 scenarios to fly. The Skyraider is now in its final development stages, with sound integration and documentation underway, before beta testing. The release is ânot far off,â with pricing set at $24.99 via the Miltech Simulations Store, iniBuilds, Blackbird Simulations Store, and the in-sim Marketplace, for both PC and Xbox. Looking ahead, Miltech also left us with a hint that the next developer blog will bring fresh news on the CH-53, U-2, and another unannounced project. entry.title: iniBuilds Releases Leeds Bradford Enhanced for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iniBuilds has recently released their enhanced rendition of Leeds Bradford Airport (EGNM) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, serving North and West Yorkshire with a yearly average of 3.3 million passengers. It opened in 1931 as Leeds and Bradford Municipal Aerodrome (or Yeadon Aerodrome). During its initial years, it was mostly used for general aviation and training, with scheduled flights starting in 1935. Work on the main terminal started around the late 30s but only reached full completion after WW2.Â Avro constructed a shadow factory during that WW2 period called the Leeds Bradford Airport Depot, with over 5,000 aircraft before its closure in December 1946. The runway was extended in the early 1980s, allowing it to be classified as a regional airport. After the extension, Wardair commenced international flights to Toronto in a 747 in 1984. The airport underwent expansion work in the late 90s and early 2000s, allowing it to reach an 88% increase in passenger traffic by 2007 (2.9 million passengers visited the airport that year). â The highest airport in the United Kingdom (681ft!) is an operating base for Jet2.com and Ryanair and is served by Aer Lingus, Aurigny, easyJet, KLM, and WizzAir. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with hand-made ground textures, true-to-life landside recreation, custom night lighting, highly detailed models, an up-to-date layout, custom jetways, PBR texturing, and more. Itâs available on the iniBuilds Store for roughly $16.21, requiring at least 2.68 GB of free hard disk space to install. 2020 owners who use the code EGNM-UG at checkout are eligible for a $5.49 upgrade path.Â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon! â

entry.title: Xtreme Prototypes Releases Gates Learjet 25 for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Xtreme Prototypes, also known as XTPRO from the Prepar3D world, has released their debut aircraft for Microsoft Flight Simulator, the GLJ Model 25 Classic SE, replicating the classic Gates Learjet 20 series. Aiming to capture the jetâs âfighter in civilian clothingâ characteristics, the team brings deep systems fidelity and plenty of polish. The cockpit is a retro-fitted fit-out, built around the GNS 530, with steam gauges modelled in full 3D, hundreds of animations, and comprehensive lighting with independent dimmers. Under the hood, custom systems cover electrics, hydraulics, pressurisation, anti-ice, fuel (including cross-feed and wingtip jettison), the CJ610 powerplants, and a fully modelled AFCS, with speed hold, yaw damper, and GPS/NAV modes. Sounds are authored in Wwise, and the aircraft features visual effects as well, ranging from exhaust heat and contrails to icing and rain. On the art side, XTPRO notes high-resolution PBR textures, detailed interior and exterior models, and 14 liveries. A 300-page manual (English or French) ships with the aircraft, also including a paint kit. Owners can even add their own custom GPS/radar or tweak aircraft behaviour, using the customisation kit. Note that such third-party avionics are supported, but not included. Xtreme Prototypes notes that the aircraft is built natively for MSFS 2020, though it can also be flown in MSFS 2024, using a compatible version. However, this version is not fully native, so you should expect potential bugs and quirks, and fly at your own discretion. A native 2024 version is coming soon, the team stated. You can find the aircraft manual here. For the full feature list, visit the official product page. For a classic and old-school Learjet experience, you can find the GLJ Model 25 Classic SE on Xtreme Prototypesâ website, for $36,06 USD. entry.title: Echo19 Releases Cessna 172 Precision Audio Pack for MSFS 2020/2024

Echo 19 has launched its Cessna 172 Precision Audio Pack for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, bringing a rich, reactive soundscape to the worldâs most-flown GA aircraft.Â Built on the developerâs new EchoFX system, the pack layers sounds that respond to airspeed, angle of attack, weather, and pilot inputs. entry.title: Azrsim Releases Heydar Aliyev International Airport for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. After releasing their Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024 versions of Heydar Aliyev International Airport (UBBB) a few weeks ago, Azrsim has now launched the X-Plane 12 version of the airport. Located in Baku, the capital of Azerbaijan, the airport serves over 7.5 million passengers each year. The airport began operations in 1933. In 1964, a new passenger terminal complex opened, increasing the facility's capacity. A new runway was inaugurated in 1998, followed by the opening of Terminal 2 in 1999. The following year, a new air traffic control (ATC) tower was constructed. In 2004, a new domestic passenger terminal was introduced, and the Baku Cargo Terminal (BCT) was launched in 2005. Additionally, an extra runway was built in 2012, and Terminal 1 was inaugurated in 2014. â The airport accommodates numerous airlines that operate both domestically and internationally, including Azerbaijan Airlines, IrAero, Pegasus Airlines, and Utair, among others. Consequently, the airport facilitates the movement of over 7.5 million passengers annually and manages nearly 60,000 flights each year. The scenery package includes features like accurately recreated terminals, hangars, and additional buildings, detailed interiors, high-resolution ground textures, detailed apron layouts, and much more.
